alert.note: Alert for Rhea (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 2:33PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Rhea County through 415 PM EDT... At 333 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Spring City, or 11 miles north of Dayton, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Spring City, Old Washington, Evensville, Piney Falls State Park and Stinging Fork Falls State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
